title.narrative: SOCIAL NORMS

description.narrative: By 2025, families and communities demonstrate strengthened capacity and commitment to protect children and women from violence, exploitation and harmful practices., which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children are safer and better protected from violence, abuse, exploitation and harm.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, families and communities demonstrate strengthened capacity and commitment to protect children and women from violence,exploitation and harmful practices.

description.narrative: To shift social norms, UNICEF is rolling out Communities Care/CC in 14 communities and piloting a safe schools programme in 53 schools. With the scale up of CC initiated in early 2021, baseline surveys have been collected across intervention sites which provide a platform to demonstrate measurable change in 2022. Programme monitoring has shown passionate engagement by young people, women and male elders and religious leaders. The school programme, aimed at empowering girls to assert themselves to avoid assault (verbally and physically) and empowering boys to intervene to prevent assault of girls and women also has baselines collected in 2021.;;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/01/2022
